title: Establishing the United States Council on Transnational Organized Crime

enrichment.summary: This executive order creates a United States Council on Transnational Organized Crime to improve coordination among federal agencies in combating international criminal networks that harm public safety, national security, and economic prosperity. It establishes an interagency working group to develop strategic plans and enhances intelligence sharing and operational efforts against transnational crime.
potential_concerns: Coordinating multiple agencies with differing priorities and authorities may lead to bureaucratic inefficiencies or interagency conflicts.
Increased intelligence and law enforcement powers may raise concerns about privacy and civil liberties protections.
The broad scope of transnational crime activities covered may challenge clear prioritization and resource allocation.
Reliance on international cooperation may face limitations due to diplomatic sensitivities or partner country capabilities.
Ensuring sustained funding and administrative support for the new council and working group could be difficult over time.
